title: Frontend: Integrate Pod Terminal into Workloads View
description: Update web/src/views/kubernetes/kubernetes-workloads.ts to add a 'Terminal' action for Pods. This action should open the pod-terminal component in a modal. Also, implement the 'Open in new tab' feature as requested, similar to the VM console.

title: Backend: Implement Pod Exec WebSocket Handler
description: Implement the backend logic to handle 'kubectl exec' over WebSocket. Re-use existing websocket infrastructure in internal/websocket/handlers.go. The handler should accept pod name, namespace, and container, and stream the shell session.

title: Web terminal support for Kubernetes's pod
description: We need you add web terminal so we can run commands inside a pod. For the backend side, re-use existing websocket events if possible. For UI, use similar UI/UX that already implemented in Virtual Machine.

title: Fix: Backend panic in PodExec handler
description: Initialized the subscriptions map in Client struct within ServePodExecWebSocket to prevent panic: assignment to entry in nil map.

title: Frontend: Create Pod Terminal Component
description: Create a web component (e.g., web/src/components/kubernetes/pod-terminal.ts) using xterm.js. It should connect to the backend WebSocket. The UI/UX should match web/src/components/virtualization/vm-console.ts (modal support, resizing).

title: Fix: Frontend build errors in PodTerminal
description: Fixed syntax error in pod-terminal.ts caused by unescaped variable in generation script. Also fixed TypeScript errors regarding override modifiers and unused imports.

title: Frontend: Add Container Selection to Terminal Modal
description: Update web/src/components/modals/terminal-modal.ts to fetch pod containers using KubernetesApi.getPodContainers. If multiple containers exist, display a dropdown selector in the modal header to switch between them. Default to the first container if none selected.
close_reason: Implemented container selection in terminal modal

title: Fix: WebSocket connection using wrong base URL
description: Updated PodTerminal to use getWsUrl helper instead of window.location.host. This ensures the correct backend port is used in development mode.
